Bahaya Komplikasi Akibat Diabetes, Kematian
07 Nov 2019, 09:53 by Antara, Yayuk Widiyarti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Penyakit diabetes tidak memberikan gejala awal yang jelas, jika gula darah tinggi biasanya buang air kecilnya banyak, cepat haus, dan lesu. Dokter penyakit dalam RSUP Sanglah, Bali, Prof. Dr. dr. Ketut Suastika, SpPD (KEMD) mengatakan diabetes memang berkaitan erat dengan kelebihan gula. Namun, yang menyebabkan kematian adalah adanya komplikasi dengan penyakit lain.
"Memang ada orang diabetes meninggal karena ketoasidosis yang artinya kegawatan diabetes. Tapi itu enggak banyak jumlahnya. Yang banyak jumlahnya adalah yang berdampak dari komplikasi," katanya.
Ia menjelaskan pasien diabetes memang ditandai oleh gula dan sering dikaitkan dengan obesitas. Namun, bisa menyebabkan kematian itu karena komplikasi, seperti dengan hipertensi atau ginjal. Ia mengatakan diabetes dipengaruhi dua komponen yang paling penting yang juga terjadi di seluruh dunia, yakni disebabkan oleh pola makan yang berlebihan dan seberapa banyak kita lakukan latihan fisik sehingga biasanya dikaitkan dengan obesitas.
Ia mengingatkan bahwa jumlah penderita diabetes Indonesia cukup mengkhawatirkan dan masuk dalam deretan 10 besar di dunia,
"Jadi kita belakangan memang cenderung latihan fisiknya kurang dan pola makan juga mulai berubah saat ini, tidak kekurangan lagi dan malah jadi berlebihan. Ini bisa jadi pemicu," tambahnya.
Ia mengatakan, sekarang banyak orang muda yang obesitas sejak awal karena pola hidup. "Kalau sudah ada usaha menurunkan berat badan dengan latihan fisik dan diet, ini bisa jadi cara mencegah komplikasi," ucapnya.
Pihaknya menyayangkan masih ada yang tidak menyadari gejala awal dan membiarkannya terjadi sehingga mengancam terjadinya komplikasi.
"Banyak sekali yang tidak sadar, dianggap biasa saja karena kelelahan. Padahal, kalau terus menerus tidak peduli, maka nanti saat diperiksa pasti ada komplikasi," jelasnya.
Untuk mengenali gejala diabetes ini bisa dengan deteksi dini melalui Indeks Massa Tubuh (IMT) untuk menentukan berat badan apakah tergolong normal atau masuk dalam kategori obesitas.
"Pakai meteran juga bisa, melingkar di pinggang di bawah pusar, kalau lebih dari 90 cm, untuk laki-laki sudah gemuk, kalau perempuan lebih dari 80 cm. Lingkar perut ini sering dihubungkan dengan diabetes dibandingkan sekedar indeks masa tubuh," kata Suastika.

Dangers of Complications Due to Diabetes, Death
Nov 7 2019, 09:53 by Antara, Yayuk Widiyarti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Diabetes does not provide clear initial symptoms, if high blood sugar usually urinates a lot, is quick to thirst, and lethargic. Doctor of internal medicine in Sanglah Hospital, Bali, Prof. Dr. dr. Ketut Suastika, SpPD (KEMD) said diabetes is indeed closely related to excess sugar. However, what causes death is complications with other diseases.
"Indeed, there are people with diabetes who died of ketoacidosis, which means the gravity of diabetes. But that's not a lot of it. The many of them are the ones that have an impact on complications," he said.
He explained that diabetic patients are marked by sugar and are often associated with obesity. However, it can cause death due to complications, such as with hypertension or kidney. He said diabetes is influenced by two of the most important components that also occur throughout the world, namely caused by excessive eating patterns and how much we do physical exercise so that it is usually associated with obesity.
He warned that the number of diabetics in Indonesia was quite alarming and included in the top 10 in the world,
"So we tend to lack physical exercise lately and our diet is also starting to change at this time, not lacking anymore and instead becoming excessive. This could be a trigger," he added.
He said, now many young people are obese since the beginning because of lifestyle. "If there has been an effort to lose weight with physical exercise and diet, this could be a way to prevent complications," he said.
It was regretted that there were still those who did not realize the initial symptoms and allowed them to occur, thereby threatening complications.
"A lot of them are unconscious, considered normal because of fatigue. In fact, if you continue to not care, then later when checked there must be complications," he explained.
To recognize the symptoms of diabetes this can be with early detection through Body Mass Index (BMI) to determine body weight whether classified as normal or included in the category of obesity.
"The meter can also be used, around the waist below the navel, if more than 90 cm, for men are overweight, if women are more than 80 cm. Abdominal circumference is often associated with diabetes than just body mass index," said Suastika.
